identifier-syntax.description:
Identifiers in the arxiv namespace are used to identify 'papers' in the arXiv.org e-print repository. The syntax of the identifier is of the form:
info:arxiv/<internal_id>
where:
<internal_id> is the arXiv.org paper identifier <internal_id> = <archive> '/' <papernum>
<archive> is the archive name with the repository <archive> = <lcletter> *( <lcletter> | '-' )
<papernum> is the number of a given paper within the archive <papernum> = 7*<digit>
<lcletter> = 'a' - 'z' <digit> = '0' - '9'
At present, <papernum> is always 7 digits but this is likely to be increased in the near future.
A 'paper' in arXiv may include one or more versions of an article or may have been deleted. Each version may be composed a number of files in different formats and a number of disseminations may also be available. As with historical use of arXiv's internal identifiers, info: identifiers using the format above identify the compound digital object including all versions.
It is intended to extend this identifier syntax to identify versions and components of papers.

identifier-normalization.description: Identifiers in this namespace are case sensitive. At present this means that all letters will be lower case.
